p: But the target of my analysis here is another family of this group (airborne), also zoonotic pathogens, classified as the ‘corona’ family, which include the now very well-known viruses causing SARS (Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome) and MERS (Middle East Respiratory Syndrome) – both resulting of a very recent mutation of a older flu-like virus first identified in 1964 ( Combs, National Geographic, 2020). These infections can manifest as bronchitis, pneumonia, or a severe respiratory illness.
